instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
The system works well with only battery connected but not charging with only charger plugged in it draws 20v with 0.00 current 
I tested another working board with charger only it draws 20v with 0.043mA I think this board should do the same if it's going to charge
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.30V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR_R</SIGNAL>=5.206V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_VDDA</SIGNAL>=5.208V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT1</SIGNAL>=fluctuating around 16.59v to 5.5v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LX1</SIGNAL>=fluctuating around 11.94 TO 0.4v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL>=not present 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON=0.200v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>=20V stable
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL>=12.13V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.30V"
Is this w/ and w/o battery the same?

If you don't use dots and commas on their places, is dificult to understand you correctly.
Do you mean the board works with battery alone, but doesn't turn on at all with charger alone (without battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.30 w/o battery.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 10.54 with battery.
The board does not turn on at all with charger alone, but turn on with battery conncted

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
"The board does not turn on at all with charger alone"
This board requires 96/140W charger; it will not start with 87W.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
I've gotten 96W charger, The board does not turn on at all with charger alone it draws 20.56v and 0.08mA without battery plugged in.
Draws 20.56v and 4.54A then goes back to 0.00mA with battery connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 10.54 with battery."
With both charger and battery connected?
Check the voltage when you have 4.5A and 0A consumption too.

Check <RESISTOR>R3021</RESISTOR>/5 and RB241/2.
<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> is high (1.8V)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> is high(1.8)? Flickers btw 
0.9 to1.79 and 1.810 when charger is plugged in with battery connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
I still expect to know <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both charger and battery connected.
You've said 10.54V with battery; charger connected also???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message: With both charger and battery connected <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 9.02volts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not charging
threads.message:
When macOS is loaded, reports correctly the battery percentage?

0.2V is high too much for <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>, if machine doesn't turn on with charger alone.
Check ohm resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR>.
